alert.note: Alert for Boyd; Brown; Holt; Keya Paha; Rock (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 16 at 8:25PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Rock, northeastern Brown, northwestern Holt, Keya Paha and western Boyd Counties through 915 PM CDT... At 825 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles east of Wewela to 7 miles northwest of Newport to 9 miles southeast of Long Pine. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bassett, Springview, Atkinson, Stuart, Butte, Long Pine, Newport, Naper, Emmet, Dustin, Burton, Anoka, Nets Peak, Hull Lake State Wildlife Management Area, Keller Park State Recreation Area, Thomas Creek State Wildlife Management Area, Mariaville, Pine Glen State Wildlife Refuge, Mills and Brocksburg. This includes the following highways... Highway 183 between mile markers 171 and 225. Highway 20 between mile markers 247 and 302. Highway 281 between mile markers 196 and 201. Highway 12 near mile marker 40, and between mile markers 47 and 119. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for north central Nebraska.

area.areaDesc: Boyd; Brown; Holt; Keya Paha; Rock
